attributes.action: acknowledge and recognise that the wealth and influence Britain now commands is partly attributed to the profits it accrued from the slave trade, by investing in the positive contributions of Black Britons.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We want the government not to apologise for slavery, but to acknowledge and recognise that the wealth and influence it now commands is partly attributed to the profits it accrued from the slave trade, whether through shipping weapons, cloth, the manufacturing of shackles and amongst other things, the selling of sugar. 

Give us back our heritage by admitting that black people were on these shores and contributed to the prosperity of  England before the colonial call to the empire, for support, in maintaining the infrastructure of this fair nation in the early 1950’s. And today invest and endorse the positive contributions black people have made to this great nation from the 17th century to the present day in industry, popular culture, politics, music, fashion and design, through compulsory education, media and the arts to help promote a lasting legacy.
